description: Gauntlets worn by Havel the Rock's warriors. Carved from solid rock, their tremendous weight is matched only by the defense they provide.  Havel's warriors never flinched nor retreated from battle. Those unfortunate enough to face them were inevitably beaten to a pulp.

name: Havel's Leggings
description: Leggings worn by Havel the Rock's warriors. Carved from solid rock, their tremendous weight is matched only by the defense they provide.  Havel's warriors never flinched nor retreated from battle. Those unfortunate enough to face them were inevitably beaten to a pulp.

name: Brass Helm
description: Helm of the Darkmoon Knightess, Fire Keeper of Anor Londo.  After becoming Undead, she visited the Dark Sun Gwyndolin at the Mausoleum of the Spiral Depths, became a Blade of the Darkmoon, and assumed the flame-keeping duty. She received this helm, which hides her hideous form and helps her hunt the guilty.

name: Brass Armor
description: Armor of the Darkmoon Knightess, Fire Keeper of Anor Londo.  After becoming Undead, she visited the Dark Sun Gwyndolin at the Mausoleum of the Spiral Depths, became a Blade of the Darkmoon, and assumed the flame-keeping duty. She received this armor, which hides her hideous form and helps her hunt the guilty.

name: Brass Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of the Darkmoon Knightess, Fire Keeper of Anor Londo.  After becoming Undead, she visited the Dark Sun Gwyndolin at the Mausoleum of the Spiral Depths, became a Blade of the Darkmoon, and assumed the flame-keeping duty. She received these gauntlets, which hide her hideous form and help her hunt the guilty.

name: Brass Leggings
description: Leggings of the Darkmoon Knightess, Fire Keeper of Anor Londo.  After becoming Undead, she visited the Dark Sun Gwyndolin at the Mausoleum of the Spiral Depths, became a Blade of the Darkmoon, and assumed the flame-keeping duty. She received these leggings, which hide her hideous form and help her hunt the guilty.

name: Gold-Hemmed Black Hood
description: Worn by the witch Quelana of Izalith, mother of pyromancy and Daughter of Chaos.  She wore this gold-hemmed black hood before even the Age of Fire, and it offers strong resistance versus fire, poison, and other perils.

name: Gold-Hemmed Black Cloak
description: Worn by the witch Quelana of Izalith, mother of pyromancy and Daughter of Chaos.  She wore this gold-hemmed black cloak before even the Age of Fire, and it offers strong resistance versus fire, poison, and other perils.

name: Gold-Hemmed Black Gloves
description: Worn by the witch Quelana of Izalith, mother of pyromancy and Daughter of Chaos.  She wore these gold-lined black gloves before even the Age of Fire, and they offer strong resistance versus fire, poison, and other perils.

name: Gold-Hemmed Black Skirt
description: Worn by the witch Quelana of Izalith, founder of pyromancy and one of the Daughters of Chaos.  She wore this gold-hemmed black skirt before even the Age of Fire, and it offers strong resistance versus fire, poison, and other perils.

name: Golem Helm
description: Head of the Iron Golem, guardian of the ancient Sen's Fortress, slayer of heroes who ventured forth to Anor Londo.  Without its core, it is a mere hunk of iron, and can be equipped as solid protective gear, but its immense weight hinders stamina recovery.

name: Golem Armor
description: Body of the Iron Golem, guardian of the ancient Sen's Fortress, slayer of heroes who ventured forth to Anor Londo.  Without its core, it is a mere hunk of iron, and can be equipped as solid protective gear, but its immense weight hinders stamina recovery.

name: Golem Gauntlets
description: Arms of the Iron Golem, guardian of the ancient Sen's Fortress, slayer of heroes who ventured forth to Anor Londo.  Without its core, they are mere hunks of iron, and can be equipped as solid protective gear, but their immense weight hinders stamina recovery.

name: Golem Leggings
description: Legs of the Iron Golem, guardian of the ancient Sen's Fortress, slayer of heroes who ventured forth to Anor Londo.  Without its core, they are mere hunks of iron, and can be equipped as solid protective gear, but their immense weight hinders stamina recovery.

name: Hollow Soldier Helm
description: Helm worn by Hollow soldiers. It may be old and battered, but its iron construction makes it quite sturdy.  It is wise to wear a sturdy form of head protection against arrows and other physical threats.

name: Hollow Soldier Armor
description: Armor worn by Hollow soldiers. It may be old and battered, but its iron construction makes it quite sturdy.

name: Soldier's Gloves
description: Soldier's Gloves

name: Hollow Soldier Waistcloth
description: Waistcloth worn by Hollow soldiers. It is so tattered that it barely serves its purpose anymore.

name: Steel Helm
description: Helm of the Knights of Berenike, known for their heavy armaments and armor.  Countless Knights of Berenike, once extolled as the mightiest of mighty, became Undead and ventured to Lordran. But their journey was for naught, as they went Hollow, and became a threat to all Undead.

name: Steel Armor
description: Armor of the Knights of Berenike, known for their heavy armaments and armor.  Countless Knights of Berenike, once extolled as the mightiest of mighty, became Undead and ventured to Lordran. But their journey was for naught, as they went Hollow, and became a threat to all Undead.

name: Steel Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of the Knights of Berenike, known for their heavy armaments and armor.  Countless Knights of Berenike, once extolled as the mightiest of mighty, became Undead and ventured to Lordran. But their journey was for naught, as they went Hollow, and became a threat to all Undead.

name: Steel Leggings
description: Leggings of the Knights of Berenike, known for their heavy armaments and armor.  Countless Knights of Berenike, once extolled as the mightiest of mighty, became Undead and ventured to Lordran. But their journey was for naught, as they went Hollow, and became a threat to all Undead.

name: Hollow Thief's Hood
description: Hood worn by Hollow thieves. Used to hide a guilty countenance.

name: Hollow Thief's Leather Armor
description: Leather armor worn by Hollow thieves. It stifles noise and helps its wearer hide in the shadows.

name: Thief's Gloves
description: Thief's Gloves

name: Hollow Thief's Tights
description: Tights worn by Hollow thieves. They stifle noise and help their wearer hide in the shadows.

name: Balder Helm
description: Helm worn by the knights of the ancient kingdom of Balder. It is made from thick iron plates.  Balder was the homeland of the Knight King Rendal, but it came to ruin after a great many Undead were spawned.

name: Balder Armor
description: Armor worn by the knights of the ancient kingdom of Balder. It is made from thick iron plates.  Balder was the homeland of the Knight King Rendal, but it came to ruin after a great many Undead were spawned.

name: Balder Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets worn by the knights of the ancient kingdom of Balder. They are made from thick iron plates.  Balder was the homeland of the Knight King Rendal, but it came to ruin after a great many Undead were spawned.

name: Balder Leggings
description: Leggings worn by the knights of the ancient kingdom of Balder. They are made from thick iron plates.  Balder was the homeland of the Knight King Rendal, but it came to ruin after a great many Undead were spawned.

name: Hollow Warrior Helm
description: Helm worn by Hollow warriors. Although it is made of iron, it is old, battered and worn out.  It is wise to wear a sturdy form of head protection against arrows and other physical threats.

name: Hollow Warrior Armor
description: Armor worn by Hollow warriors. It is made of thick leather that is tattered with age.

name: Warrior's Gloves
description: Warrior's Gloves

name: Hollow Warrior Waistcloth
description: Waistcloth worn by Hollow warriors. It is so tattered that it barely serves its purpose anymore.

name: Giant Helm
description: Helm of the giant sentinels of Anor Londo.  Made from ancient brass, it also offers protection versus non-physical attacks, but due to its giant size, it is extremely heavy for humans, and impedes stamina recovery.

name: Giant Armor
description: Armor of the giant sentinels of Anor Londo.  Made from ancient brass, it also offers protection versus non-physical attacks, but due to its giant size, it is extremely heavy for humans, and impedes stamina recovery.

name: Giant Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of the giant sentinels of Anor Londo.  Made from ancient brass, they also offer protection versus non-physical attacks, but due to their giant size, they are extremely heavy for humans, and impede stamina recovery.

name: Giant Leggings
description: Leggings of the giant sentinels of Anor Londo.  Made from ancient brass, they also offer protection versus non-physical attacks, but due to their giant size, they are extremely heavy for humans, and impede stamina recovery.

name: Crown of the Dark Sun
description: Crown of the Dark Sun Gwyndolin, protector of the forsaken city of Anor Londo.  This crown of the gods demands faith immeasurable of its wearer, but it is imbued with Darkmoon power that enhances all magic. The image of the sun manifests Gwyndolin's deep adoration of the sun.

name: Moonlight Robe
description: Robe of the Dark Sun Gwyndolin, protector of the forsaken city of Anor Londo.  The power of the moon was strong in Gwyndolin, and thus he was raised as a daughter. His magic garb is silk-thin, and hardly provides any physical defense.

name: Moonlight Gloves
description: Gloves of the Dark Sun Gwyndolin, protector of the forsaken city of Anor Londo.  The power of the moon was strong in Gwyndolin, and thus he was raised as a daughter. His magic garb is silk-thin, and hardly provides any physical defense.

name: Moonlight Waistcloth
description: Waistcloth of the Dark Sun Gwyndolin, protector of the forsaken city of Anor Londo.  The power of the moon was strong in Gwyndolin, and thus he was raised as a daughter. His magic garb is silk-thin, and hardly provides any physical defense.

name: Crown of the Great Lord
description: Crown of Gwyn, Lord of Cinder, who linked the First Flame.  Lord Gwyn, bearer of the ultimate soul, divided his power among his great clan before linking the flame. But he did keep his crown, perhaps to preserve a symbol of the monarch, for its actual power had fully subsided.

name: Robe of the Great Lord
description: Robe of Gwyn, Lord of Cinder, who linked the First Flame.  Lord Gwyn, bearer of the ultimate soul, divided that power among his clan before linking the flame. When he departed, he left only with his greatsword, his garb, and the crown, now bereft of power.

name: Bracelet of the Great Lord
description: Bracelets of Gwyn, Lord of Cinder, who linked the First Flame.  Lord Gwyn, bearer of the ultimate soul, divided that power among his clan before linking the flame. When he departed, he left only with his greatsword, his garb, and the crown, now bereft of power.

name: Anklet of the Great Lord
description: Anklets of Gwyn, Lord of Cinder, who linked the First Flame.  Lord Gwyn, bearer of the ultimate soul, divided that power among his clan before linking the flame. When he departed, he left only with his greatsword, his garb, and the crown, now bereft of power.

name: Sack
description: Bloodstained patchwork sack by the Undead man-eating cook lurking in the Depths. Two eyeholes have been haphazardly cut out.  It is unexpectedly soft and comfortable to wear, but it is probably near meaningless in terms of defense.

name: Symbol of Avarice
description: Monster head resembling a treasure chest. Once an ancient god, it is said this is the symbol of shame imposed on a long lost clan, exiled for the sin of avarice.  Wearing this slightly raises soul absorption and item discovery, but also affects its wearer with the curse of the branded.

name: Royal Helm
description: Helm of Vamos, skeleton blacksmith of the Catacombs. Partially made of gold, and confers high resistance overall.  The helm is believed to belong to an ancient royal line, but only Vamos would know for sure, and he shall never speak again.

name: Mask of the Father
description: One of the three masks of the Pinwheel, the necromancer who stole the power of the Gravelord, and reigns over the Catacombs.  This mask, belonging to the valiant father, slightly raises equipment load.

name: Mask of the Mother
description: One of the three masks of the Pinwheel, the necromancer who stole the power of the Gravelord, and reigns over the Catacombs.  This mask, belonging to the kindly mother, slightly raises HP.

name: Mask of the Child
description: One of the three masks of the Pinwheel, the necromancer who stole the power of the Gravelord, and reigns over the Catacombs.  This mask, belonging to the naive child, slightly raises stamina recovery speed.

name: Fang Boar Helm
description: Severed head of the fully-armored Fang Boar taken by the one who killed it as proof of his victory, just as the Gods once did with the head of the ancient dragon.  Can be worn on the head as a surprisingly sound piece of protective gear.

name: Gargoyle Helm
description: Helm of the gargoyle, an enchanted creature that guarded the Bell of Awakening in the belfry of the Undead Church.  This bronze helm was for mere appearance's sake, as gargoyle skin is naturally hard. Little in the way of defense can be expected from it.

name: Black Sorcerer Hat
description: Hat worn by the secret sorcerers at Vinheim Dragon School.  They secretly work with sound-based spells, and never reveal themselves.

name: Black Sorcerer Cloak
description: Cloak worn by the secret sorcerers at Vinheim Dragon School.  They secretly work with sound-based spells, and never reveal themselves.

name: Black Sorcerer Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets worn by the secret sorcerers at Vinheim Dragon School.  They secretly work with sound-based spells, and never reveal themselves.

name: Black Sorcerer Boots
description: Boots worn by the secret sorcerers at Vinheim Dragon School.  They secretly work with sound-based spells, and never reveal themselves.

name: Elite Cleric Helm
description: Helm worn by the warrior clerics of the Way of White, who are famous for being unyielding in battle.  Among such helms, those that were black belonged to warrior clerics sent on missions, many of whom were high-level priests.

name: Elite Cleric Armor
description: Armor worn by the warrior clerics of the Way of White, who are famous for being unyielding in battle.  Among such armors, those that were black belonged to warrior clerics sent on missions, many of whom were high-level priests.

name: Elite Cleric Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets worn by the warrior clerics of the Way of White, who are famous for being unyielding in battle.  Among such gauntlets, those that were black belonged to warrior clerics sent on missions, many of whom were high-level priests.

name: Elite Cleric Leggings
description: Leggings worn by the warrior clerics of the Way of White, who are famous for being unyielding in battle.  Among such leggings, those that were black belonged to warrior clerics sent on missions, many of whom were high-level priests.

name: Head
description: Head

name: Body
description: Body

name: Arms
description: Arms

name: Legs
description: Legs

name: No Travel Gear / Head
description: No Travel Gear / Head

name: No Travel Gear / Body
description: No Travel Gear / Body

name: No Travel Gear / Arms
description: No Travel Gear / Arms

name: No Travel Gear / Legs
description: No Travel Gear / Legs

name: Dragon Head
description: Transform the head into that of a dragon with a secret rite of the transcendent apostles. Use Dragon Head Stone in this state to spew dragon breath.  The dragon apostles seek transcendence of life itself, attainable by transformation into an ancient drag

name: Dragon Body
description: Transform the body into that of a dragon with a secret rite of the transcendent apostles. Use Dragon Torso Stone in this state to let out a great dragon roar.  The dragon apostles seek transcendence of life itself, attainable by transformation into an an

name: Dragon Arms
description: Transform arms into those of a dragon with a secret rite of the transcendent apostles. Use Dragon Torso Stone in this state to create dragon roar and wield talons from the hands.  The dragon apostles seek transcendence of life itself, attainable by trans

name: Dragon Legs
description: Transform legs into those of a dragon with a secret rite of the transcendent apostles. Use Dragon Torso Stone in this state to let out a great dragon roar.  The dragon apostles seek transcendence of life itself, attainable by transformation into an ancie

name: Fallen Knight Helm
description: Helm of an order of fallen knights who disbanded and fled, but met untimely deaths.  The drab, tattered hood conceals tough, black metal which provides dependable protection from fire. It is just possible to make out the majestic gold engravings on its surface.

name: Fallen Knight Armor
description: Armor of an order of fallen knights who disbanded and fled, but met untimely deaths.  The drab, tattered cloth conceals tough, black metal which provides dependable protection from fire. It is just possible to make out the majestic gold engravings on its surface.

name: Fallen Knight Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of an order of fallen knights who disbanded and fled, but met untimely deaths.  The drab, tattered cloth conceals tough, black metal which provides dependable protection from fire. It is just possible to make out the majestic gold engravings on its surface.

name: Fallen Knight Trousers
description: Trousers of an order of fallen knights.  Held beneath leather boots and drab cloth using a knot of rope and bandage, they are dampened and indelibly stained with the misery of flight.

name: Knight Helm
description: Helm of a lowly knight, fashioned from solid iron.  This iron helm might be on the heftier side compared to others of its ilk, but as such offers great physical absorption in exchange for its imposing weight. Do not think to wear it without the necessary vitality.

name: Knight Armor
description: Armor of a lowly knight, fashioned from solid iron.  This iron armor might be on the heftier side compared to others of its ilk, but as such offers great physical absorption in exchange for its imposing weight. Do not think to wear it without the necessary vitality.

name: Knight Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of a lowly knight, fashioned from solid iron.  These gauntlets might be on the heftier side compared to others of their ilk, but as such offer great physical absorption in exchange for their imposing weight. Do not think to wear it without the necessary vitality.

name: Knight Leggings
description: Leggings of a lowly knight, fashioned from solid iron.  These leggings might be on the heftier side compared to others of their ilk, but as such offer great physical absorption in exchange for their imposing weight. Do not think to wear it without the necessary vitality.

name: Firelink Helm
description: Helm of the Soul of Cinder, a deific manifestation of the Lords of Cinder, who linked the First Flame.  It resembles a knight's helm, but bears hideous burns and contortions. A misshapen crown can be seen upon its rear.  It exists as a symbol of the great Lords and the noble act of linking the fire, though it is no more than an empty husk.

name: Firelink Armor
description: Armor of the Soul of Cinder, a deific manifestation of the Lords of Cinder, who linked the First Flame.  It resembles a knight's armor, but bears hideous burns and contortions, taking the shape of a deathly ribcage.  It exists as a symbol of the great Lords and the noble act of linking the fire, though it is no more than an empty husk.

name: Firelink Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of the Soul of Cinder, a deific manifestation of the Lords of Cinder, who linked the First Flame.  They resemble a knight's gauntlets, but bear hideous burns and contortions.  They exist as a symbol of the great Lords and the noble act of linking the fire, though they are no more than empty husks.

name: Firelink Leggings
description: Leggings of the Soul of Cinder, a deific manifestation of the Lords of Cinder, who linked the First Flame.  They resemble a knight's leggings, but bear hideous burns and contortions. They exist as a symbol of the great Lords and the noble act of linking the fire, though they are no more than empty husks.

name: Sellsword Helm
description: Metal helm interwoven with coarse cloth. Able to endure the hardships of battle and prolonged travel.  It is light considering the build, striking a fine balance between absorption and substance.

name: Sellsword Armor
description: Metal armor interwoven with coarse cloth. Able to endure the hardships of battle and prolonged travel.  It is light considering the build, striking a fine balance between absorption and substance.

name: Sellsword Gauntlet
description: Metal gauntlet interwoven with coarse cloth. Able to endure the hardships of battle and prolonged travel.  Frequent shield users lighten the load by wearing a gauntlet on only one arm.

name: Sellsword Trousers
description: These cloth trousers and leather boots are of no real note, but are durable and allow for easy movement. Able to endure the hardships of battle and prolonged travel.

name: Herald Helm
description: Steel helm said to be worn by Heralds of the Way of White, who deliver commandments of duty.  Protection made of steel has excellent physical absorption, but is found lacking against blunt strikes and lightning damage.

name: Herald Armor
description: Steel armor with a pure white cape, the signature of Heralds of the way of White.  Protection made of steel has excellent physical absorption, but is found lacking against blunt strikes and lightning damage.

name: Herald Gloves
description: Leather gloves said to be worn by Heralds of the way of White, who deliver commandments of duty.  Fairly plain, but made to last on long journeys.

name: Herald Trousers
description: Quilted trousers said to be worn by Heralds of the way of White, who deliver commandments of duty.  The insulated material is effective against strike damage, nicely complementing steel protective wear.

name: Sunless Veil
description: Attire of a knight from the Sunless Realms, known for their resistance to both magic and the dark.  Formed of a silk veil and silver headband.  Sunless Knights serve the nameless moon, and perhaps it is for this reason the attire casts a feminine silhouette.

name: Sunless Armor
description: Attire of a knight from the Sunless Realms, known for their resistance to both magic and the dark.  Metal plating and chainmail, treated with silver.  Sunless Knights serve the nameless moon, and perhaps it is for this reason the attire casts a feminine silhouette.

name: Sunless Gauntlets
description: Attire of a knight from the Sunless Realms, known for their resistance to both magic and the dark.  Iron gauntlets, partially treated with silver.  Sunless Knights serve the nameless moon, and perhaps it is for this reason the attire casts a feminine silhouette.

name: Sunless Leggings
description: Attire of a knight from the Sunless Realms, known for  their resistance to both magic and the dark. Metal leggings and chainmail, treated with silver.  Sunless Knights serve the nameless moon, and perhaps it is for this reason the attire casts a feminine silhouette.

name: Black Hand Hat
description: Attire of hunters known as the King's Black Hands. This wide-brimmed hat is emblematic of the role.  Black Hand was a title established to honor hunters who served successive kings. To date, no more than three such individuals have borne this distinction.

name: Black Hand Armor
description: Attire of hunters known as the King's Black Hands. A black cape covers leather armor, shrouding the wearer in darkness.  Black Hand was a title established to honor hunters who served successive generations of kings. To date, no more than three such individuals have borne this distinction.

name: Assassin Gloves
description: Soft leather gloves worn by assassins who lurk in the shadows.  The thick leather offers reasonable absorption without creating any undesired noise. A well-crafted piece of protection.

name: Assassin Trousers
description: Soft leather trousers worn by assassins who lurk in the shadows.  The thick leather offers reasonable absorption without creating any undesired noise. A well-crafted piece of protection.

name: Assassin Hood
description: Black cloth covering the face of the assassins who lurk in the shadows.  Grants much-needed protection to the head as well as cover from rain while pursuing a target on the road.

name: Assassin Armor
description: Soft leather armor worn by assassins who lurk in the shadows.  The thick leather offers reasonable absorption without creating any undesired noise. A well-crafted piece of protection.  Critical spots are reinforced with metal.

name: Xanthous Crown
description: Crown supposedly made in imitation of a divine creature of Oolacile, land of ancient, golden sorceries.  Xanthous clothing is the mark of a researcher of lost sorceries, and the oversized crown is emblematic of their work. Such a curious pursuit is surely nothing to be ashamed of.

name: Xanthous Overcoat
description: Yellowish overcoat covering a band of brass medallions.  Xanthous clothing is the mark of a researcher of lost sorceries, and the number of medallions denotes their success. A point of pride for the researchers, even if its significance is lost on others.

name: Xanthous Gloves
description: Yellowish gloves.  Xanthous clothing is the mark of a researcher of lost sorceries, and it is said that with golden sorceries, one could manipulate light.

name: Xanthous Trousers
description: Yellowish trousers.  Xanthous clothing is the mark of a researcher of lost sorceries, and it is said that with golden sorceries, one could manipulate light.

name: Northern Helm
description: Iron helm of a stalwart northern warrior. Engraved with an ornate pattern.  Iron defensive wear grants superior stability. Being from the north, it should also offer resistance to the cold.

name: Northern Armor
description: Iron armor of a stalwart northern warrior. Supported by interwoven chainmail.  Iron defensive wear grants superior absorption. Being from the north, it should also offer resistance to the cold.

name: Northern Gloves
description: Gloves of a stalwart northern warrior. Made of thick leather.  In addition to their protection from blunt strikes, they excel at retaining heat, providing good resistance to the cold.

name: Northern Trousers
description: Trousers of a stalwart northern warrior. Thick leather boots lined with fur.  In addition to their protection from blunt strikes, they excel at retaining heat, providing good resistance to the cold.

name: Morne's Helm
description: Unusual helm bestowed upon knights of Carim.  Modeled on Morne, the Archbishop's apostle, the helm is of perfect likeness to the stone heads lining the cathedral.  A Carim knight will dedicate an entire career to attending a single maiden, just as Morne once served one goddess alone.

name: Morne's Armor
description: Black armor bestowed upon knights of Carim.  Modeled on Morne, the Archbishop's apostle, cast from a unique mineral resembling stone.  A Carim knight will dedicate an entire career to attending a single maiden, just as Morne once served one goddess alone.

name: Morne's Gauntlets
description: Black gauntlets bestowed upon knights of Carim.  Modelled on Morne, the Archbishop's apostle, cast from a unique mineral resembling stone.  A Carim knight will dedicate an entire career to attending a single maiden, just as Morne once served one goddess alone.

name: Morne's Leggings
description: Black leggings bestowed upon knights of Carim.  Modelled on Morne, the Archbishop's apostle, cast from a unique mineral resembling stone.  A Carim knight will dedicate an entire career to attending a single maiden, just as Morne once served one goddess alone.

name: Silver Mask
description: Silver mask of Ringfinger Leonhard.  In his youth, Leonhard suffered grave burns to his entire body. His face in particular, which he hid beneath his mask, was terribly scalded.  He abstained from restoring these injuries, even after becoming a Finger of Rosaria,

name: Leonhard's Garb
description: Garb of Ringfinger Leonhard.  Leonhard was born into royalty, which is believed to be the reason for his skill in both sorcery and swordsmanship.  Indeed, this dingy garb is in fact embroidered with gold thread, betraying its purpose as military wear designed for a noble.

name: Leonhard's Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of Ringfinger Leonhard.  Leonhard was born into royalty, which is believed to be the reason for his skill in both sorcery and swordsmanship.  Indeed, these dingy gauntlets are in fact decorated with silver, betraying their purpose as military wear designed for a noble.

name: Leonhard's Trousers
description: Trousers of Ringfinger Leonhard.  Leonhard was born into royalty, which is believed to be the reason for his skill in both sorcery and swordsmanship.  Indeed, these dingy trousers are in fact meticulously tanned, betraying their purpose as military wear designed for a noble.

name: Sneering Mask
description: Gold mask worn by those who kill in the name of the Sable Church of Londor.  A faint, kindly smile is bound to its surface, giving them the moniker Harlots of Death.  What lies beneath that expression, however, is nothing more than the face of a darkly shriveled Hollow.

name: Pale Shade Robe
description: Attire worn by those who kill in the name of the Sable Church of Londor.  The Pale Shades of the Sable Church are all undying Hollows, giving rise to much fear and contempt.  Their fight is one of neither honor nor exaltation, yielding nothing but withered moans.

name: Pale Shade Gloves
description: Outfit worn by those who kill in the name of the Sable Church of Londor.  The Pale Shades of the Sable Church are all undying Hollows, giving rise to much fear and contempt.  Their fight is one of neither honor nor exaltation, yielding nothing but withered moans.

name: Sunset Helm
description: Helm of Hodrick, holy knight of the Sunless Realms.  This light gold helm, named for its sunset hues, is now faded and wrapped in tainted rags.  The sorry fool was known to wander the battlefield as a crazed ghoul, lashing out at friend and foe alike.

name: Sunset Armor
description: Armor of Hodrick, holy knight of the Sunless Realms.  This light gold armor, named for its sunset hues, is now faded and wrapped in tainted rags.  The sorry fool was known to wander the battlefield as a crazed ghoul, lashing out at friend and foe alike.

name: Sunset Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of Hodrick, holy knight of the Sunless Realms.  These light gold gauntlets, named for their sunset hues, are now faded and wrapped in tainted rags.  The sorry fool was known to wander the battlefield as a crazed ghoul, lashing out at friend and foe alike.

name: Sunset Leggings
description: Leggings of Hodrick, holy knight of the Sunless Realms.  These light gold leggings, named for their sunset hues, are now faded and wrapped in tainted rags.  The sorry fool was known to wander the battlefield as a crazed ghoul, lashing out at friend and foe alike.

name: Old Sage's Blindfold
description: Attire of pyromancers of the Great Swamp, particularly favored by old sages.  The large blindfold blocks out unnecessary light, allowing one to observe a pyromancy's true essence.  The flame reveals all, and obscures all.

name: Cornyx's Garb
description: Attire of Cornyx, pyromancer of the Great Swamp.  In the Great Swamp, it was customary to adorn oneself with articles of nature. Cornyx favored the use of raven feathers.  Ravens are said to have once been Firelink messengers, guiding the undead to the land of ancient gods.

name: Cornyx's Wrap
description: Attire of Cornyx, pyromancer of the Great Swamp. The bronze ornamentation serves to ward off evil spirits.

name: Cornyx's Skirt
description: Attire of Cornyx, pyromancer of the Great Swamp.  This long skirt emulates those worn by witches, who were the forebears of pyromancy.

name: Executioner Helm
description: Steel helm of Horace the Hushed, who took a liking to its cold, bulky insides.  The original owner was said to be a corrupt executioner, who was killed and stripped of his armor.  Horace is one of only two children to escape Aldrich's clutches.

name: Executioner Armor
description: Steel armor of Horace the Hushed, who took a liking to its cold, bulky insides.  The original owner was said to be a corrupt executioner, who was killed and stripped of his armor.  Horace is one of only two children to escape Aldrich's clutches.

name: Executioner Gauntlets
description: Steel gauntlets of Horace the Hushed, who took a liking to their cold, bulky insides.  The original owner was said to be a corrupt executioner, who was killed and stripped of his armor.  Horace is one of only two children to escape Aldrich's clutches.

name: Executioner Leggings
description: Steel leggings of Horace the Hushed, who took a liking to their cold, bulky insides.  The original owner was said to be a corrupt executioner, who was killed and stripped of his armor.  Horace is one of only two children to escape Aldrich's clutches.

name: Billed Mask
description: Attire of the three mentors of the Sable Church of Londor, this billed mask belongs to Yuria, the second eldest.  These maidens of a Primordial Serpent were renowned as founders of the Sable Church, which offered salvation for Hollows.

name: Black Dress
description: Attire of the three mentors of the Sable Church of Londor, this pitch-black dress resembles a mourning dress.  These maidens of a Primordial Serpent were renowned as founders of the Sable Church, which offered salvation for Hollows.

name: Black Gauntlets
description: Attire of the three mentors of the Sable Church of Londor, these black gauntlets are hidden by the dress.  It is apparent that the women in black were highly skilled fencers, capable of founding the Sable Church between just the three of them.

name: Black Leggings
description: Attire of the three mentors of the Sable Church of Londor, these black leggings are hidden by the dress.  It is apparent that the women in black were highly skilled fencers, capable of founding the Sable Church between just the three of them.

name: Pyromancer Crown
description: Attire of pyromancers of the Great Swamp. Comprised of a leather crown and animal bones.  In the Great Swamp, it was thought that adorning oneself with natural fauna would provide protection from the flames of pyromancy.

name: Pyromancer Garb
description: Attire of pyromancers of the Great Swamp. Comprised of bronze ornamentation and animal pelt.  In the Great Swamp, bronze was used ritualistically to ward off evil spirits and keep darkness at bay.

name: Pyromancer Wrap
description: Attire of pyromancers of the Great Swamp. Leather wrapped plainly around the arms.

name: Pyromancer Trousers
description: Attire of pyromancers of the Great Swamp. Cloth trousers wound tightly with leather, and fitted with dermis split-toe shoes.  The life of a pyromancer is a life of endless trudging through marshland.

name: Court Sorcerer Hood
description: Hood worn by court sorcerers of the Profaned Capital.  This tall, dark headpiece suggests they may have also been oracles.  There are many sorcerers who claim to heirship to the great sage "Big Hat" Logan, and the Profaned Capital houses one of two leading schools.

name: Court Sorcerer Robe
description: Robe worn by court sorcerers of the Profaned Capital.  The formal gold stitching suggests they may have also been oracles.  There are many sorcerers who claim heirship to the great sage "Big Hat" Logan, and the Profaned Capital houses one of two leading schools.

name: Court Sorcerer Gloves
description: Silk gloves worn by court sorcerers of the Profaned Capital. These figures may have also been oracles.  There are many sorcerers who claim heirship to the great sage "Big Hat" Logan, and the Profaned Capital houses one of two leading schools.

name: Court Sorcerer Trousers
description: Trousers worn by court sorcerers of the Profaned Capital. These figures may have also been oracles.  There are many sorcerers who claim heirship to the great sage "Big Hat" Logan, and the Profaned Capital houses one of two leading schools.

name: Sorcerer Hood
description: Attire of a sorcerer from the Vinheim Dragon School. A simple hood worn inside the robes.  Represents those who have outgrown the academy, abandoning formal headwear and distancing themselves in order to continue their research in solitude.

name: Sorcerer Robe
description: Attire of a sorcerer from the Vinheim Dragon School. Long, ash-colored robes.  Underneath is a deep blue sorcerer's coat; conventional uniform of the academy.

name: Sorcerer Gloves
description: Attire of a sorcerer from the Vinheim Dragon School. Black-dyed leather gloves embellished with silver medallions.

name: Sorcerer Trousers
description: Attire of a sorcerer from the Vinheim Dragon School. Black-dyed leather trousers and rugged boots.  A sorcerer knows that long-term research means a lengthy and arduous road ahead.

name: Clandestine Coat
description: Traditional coat of the Vinheim Dragon School.  Normally a deep blue color, this black variation is a sign of a sorcerer engaged in surreptitious work. These were covert agents who excelled at manipulating sound.

name: Cleric Hat
description: Hat worn by a cleric turned undead. Typical attire for blue-robed travelers.  It is said that they were entrusted with a duty, still its nature is yet to be revealed.

name: Cleric Blue Robe
description: Garb worn by a cleric turned undead. Unmistakable vibrant blue robes.  It is said that the blue-robed travelers were entrusted with a duty. They bore large covers on their backs to ensure that they would not become seedbeds for spreading darkness.

name: Cleric Gloves
description: Gloves worn by a cleric turned undead. Typical attire for blue-robed travelers.  It is said that they were entrusted with a duty, still its nature is yet to be revealed.

name: Cleric Trousers
description: Trousers worn by a cleric turned undead. Typical attire for blue-robed travelers.  It is said that they were entrusted with a duty, still its nature is yet to be revealed.

name: Dingy Maiden's Overcoat
description: Dingy overcoat worn by traveling maidens.  Although stained from a long journey, this item has yet to lose its divine power, remaining effective as a piece of protective wear.

name: Grotto Hat
description: Hat of a sorcerer who distanced himself from this world.  Looks terribly worn-out, but the fabric's surface is reinforced with magic.

name: Grotto Robe
description: Robe of a sorcerer who distanced himself from this world.  Looks terribly worn-out, but the fabric's surface is reinforced with magic.

name: Grotto Wrap
description: Gloves of a sorcerer who distanced himself from this world.  Looks terribly worn-out, but the fabric's surface is reinforced with magic.

name: Grotto Trousers
description: Waistcloth of a sorcerer who distanced himself from this world.  Looks terribly worn-out, but the fabric's surface is reinforced with magic.

name: Steel Soldier Helm
description: Typical helm for a Lothric soldier. Iron-made, but half fallen apart.  It is never unwise to wear a sturdy form of head protection against arrows and other somatic threats.

name: Deserter Armor
description: Common soldier's armor. Its insignia is worn beyond recognition.  This musty, rusted hunk of metal befits one reduced to thievery.

name: Soldier's Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets supplied to common soldiers protecting Lothric.  Its simple build offers the bare minimum of protection in battle, but is comparatively lightweight and manageable.

name: Deserter Trousers
description: Common soldier's trousers.  This musty, rusted hunk of metal befits one reduced to thievery.

name: Soldier's Hood
description: Hood supplied to common soldiers protecting Lothric.  Its simple build offers the bare minimum of protection in battle, but is comparatively lightweight and manageable.

name: Thief Mask
description: Mask worn by those with something to hide. Used to conceal the face, muffle the voice, and go by cover of darkness.

name: Sage's Big Hat
description: Enormous hat that completely obscures the face. Belonged to twin gurus known as the Crystal Sages.  The pair are said to be successors to the great sage Logan, and this big hat is a symbol of their pedigree.

name: Elder's Robe
description: Robe worn by an elder who went to the extremes of sorcery.  These robes have served the elder over many years of devoted study. Constantly exposed to magical power, they became formal wear for high-ranking sorcerers.

name: Aristocrat's Mask
description: Mask worn by jailers of Irithyll Dungeon. Noblemen delighted in its plump features.  The jailers were among the few survivors inhabiting the Profaned Capital, later serving under Pontiff Sulyvahn. Perhaps the screams emanating from the cells help them forget their old home.

name: Jailer Robe
description: Robe worn by jailers of Irithyll Dungeon. Originally ritualistic formal wear.  The jailers were among the few survivors inhabiting the Profaned Capital, later serving under Pontiff Sulyvahn. Perhaps the screams emanating from the cells help them forget their old home.

name: Jailer Gloves
description: Gloves worn by jailers of Irithyll Dungeon.  The jailers were among the few survivors inhabiting the Profaned Capital, later serving under Pontiff Sulyvahn. Perhaps the screams emanating from the cells help them forget their old home.

name: Jailer Trousers
description: Trousers worn by jailers of Irithyll Dungeon.  The jailers were among the few survivors inhabiting the Profaned Capital, later serving under Pontiff Sulyvahn. Perhaps the screams emanating from the cells help them forget their old home.

name: Saint's Veil
description: Veil worn by the young crossbreed taken prisoner within the dungeon.  Originally pure white, years of incarceration have stained it ash grey.

name: Saint's Dress
description: Dress worn by the young crossbreed taken prisoner within the dungeon.  Originally pure white, years of incarceration have stained it ash grey.

name: Footman's Hood
description: Hood worn by a manservant who roams the Undead Commune.  The lowly footmen were given the most dejectable tasks among citizens of the Undead Commune. Their superhuman strength far exceeds that of an ordinary person, and if agitated can become quite uncontrolable.

name: Footman's Overcoat
description: Overcoat worn by a manservant who roams the Undead Commune.  The lowly footmen were given the most dejectable tasks among citizens of the Undead Commune. Their superhuman strength far exceeds that of an ordinary person, and if agitated can become quite uncontrolable.

name: Footman's Bracelets
description: Bracelets worn by a manservant who roams the Undead Commune.  The lowly footmen were given the most dejectable tasks among citizens of the Undead Commune. Their superhuman strength far exceeds that of an ordinary person, and if agitated can become quite uncontrolable.

name: Footman's Trousers
description: Trousers worn by a manservant who roams the Undead Commune.  The lowly footmen were given the most dejectable tasks among citizens of the Undead Commune. Their superhuman strength far exceeds that of an ordinary person, and if agitated can become quite uncontrolable.

name: Grave Warden Hood
description: Rotting, tattered hood. Attire of grave wardens at the Cathedral of the Deep.  Grave wardens were tasked with disposing of the ever rising corpses that plagued the cathedral. Their clothes are utterly putrid, drenched in the blood and mucilage of their undertaking.

name: Grave Warden Robe
description: Rotting, tattered robe. Attire of grave wardens at the Cathedral of the Deep.  Grave wardens were tasked with disposing of the ever rising corpses that plagued the cathedral. Their clothes are utterly putrid, drenched in the blood and mucilage of their undertaking.

name: Grave Warden Wrap
description: Rotting, tattered wrap. Attire of grave wardens at the Cathedral of the Deep.  Grave wardens were tasked with disposing of the ever rising corpses that plagued the cathedral. Their clothes are utterly putrid, drenched in the blood and mucilage of their undertaking.

name: Grave Warden Skirt
description: Rotting, tattered skirt. Attire of grave wardens at the Cathedral of the Deep.  Grave wardens were tasked with disposing of the ever rising corpses that plagued the cathedral. Their clothes are utterly putrid, drenched in the blood and mucilage of their undertaking.

name: Worker Hat
description: Hat worn by inhabitants of the Undead Settlement.  Official attire for the dissection and burial of undead. Naturally, the ceremonial significance of such work is long forgotten.  Indeed, no one could continue to entertain such horrors.

name: Worker Garb
description: Garb worn by inhabitants of the Undead Settlement.  Official attire for the dissection and burial of undead. Naturally, the ceremonial significance of such work is long forgotten.  Indeed, no one could continue to entertain such horrors.

name: Worker Gloves
description: Gloves worn by inhabitants of the Undead Settlement.  Official attire for the dissection and burial of undead. Naturally, the ceremonial significance of such work is long forgotten.  Indeed, no one could continue to entertain such horrors.

name: Worker Trousers
description: Trousers worn by inhabitants of the Undead Settlement.  Naturally, the ceremonial significance of such work is long forgotten.  Indeed, no one could continue to entertain such horrors.

name: Thrall Hood
description: Hood used to cover the head of lesser folk who were set to work as slaves throughout Lothric.  Also occasionally used to shame and humiliate criminals.

name: Evangelist Hat
description: Hat of an evangelist sent from the cathedral.  These teachers, all women, came to enlighten inhabitants of the Undead Settlement and sent carriers on the path of sacrifice.

name: Evangelist Robe
description: Robe of an evangelist sent from the cathedral.  These teachers, all women, came to enlighten inhabitants of the Undead Settlement and sent carriers on the path of sacrifice.

name: Evangelist Gloves
description: Gloves of an evangelist sent from the cathedral.  These teachers, all women, came to enlighten inhabitants of the Undead Settlement and sent carriers on the path of sacrifice.

name: Evangelist Trousers
description: Trousers of an evangelist sent from the cathedral.  These teachers, all women, came to enlighten inhabitants of the Undead Settlement and sent carriers on the path of sacrifice.

name: Scholar's Shed Skin
description: Skin shed from a sage of the Grand Archives. The ivory wax has hardened, forming a mask.  Wax protected the inquirer from exposure to the foulness that permeated the majority of the texts, preventing one's anchor of reason from being too easily washed away.

name: Scholar's Robe
description: Robe of a sage from the Grand Archives, stained quite deliberately with wax.  The scholars of the Grand Archives, sorcerers by craft, tend to their candles with a reverence that exceeds the simple burden of labor. They know dangers of the Archives' store of knowledge all too well.

name: Winged Knight Helm
description: Armor of the Winged Knights, who swore themselves to the Angels.  Worship of the divine messengers was viewed as heresy in Lothric and unrecognized by any of the Three Pillars of rule.  This is believed to be why Gertrude, the Heavenly Daughter, was imprisoned in the lofty cell of the Grand Archives.

name: Winged Knight Armor
description: Armor of the Winged Knights, named for their appearance, who swore themselves to the Angels.  Worship of the divine messengers was viewed as heresy in Lothric and unrecognized by any of the Three Pillars of rule.  This is believed to be why Gertrude, the Heavenly Daughter, was imprisoned in the lofty cell of the Grand Archives.

name: Winged Knight Gauntlets
description: Armor of the Winged Knights, who swore themselves to the Angels.  Worship of the divine messengers was viewed as heresy in Lothric and unrecognized by any of the Three Pillars of rule.  This is believed to be why Gertrude, the Heavenly Daughter, was imprisoned in the lofty cell of the Grand Archives.

name: Cathedral Knight Helm
description: Massive iron helm worn by knights serving the Cathedral of the Deep.  Repulsive creatures of the deep are sure to attract the foolish, but the cathedral knights are prepared to meet such intruders head on with their more than ample might.

name: Cathedral Knight Armor
description: Massive iron armor worn by knights serving the Cathedral of the Deep.  Repulsive creatures of the deep are sure to attract the foolish, but the cathedral knights are prepared to meet such intruders head on with their more than ample might.

name: Cathedral Knight Gauntlets
description: Massive iron gauntlets worn by knights serving the Cathedral of the Deep.  Repulsive creatures of the deep are sure to attract the foolish, but the cathedral knights are prepared to meet such intruders head on with their more than ample might.

name: Cathedral Knight Leggings
description: Massive iron leggings worn by knights serving the Cathedral of the Deep.  Repulsive creatures of the deep are sure to attract the foolish, but the cathedral knights are prepared to meet such intruders head on with their more than ample might.

name: Lothric Knight Helm
description: Armor of a celebrated Lothric knight. A strong steel helm, if a little worn.  The Knight has served as one of the Three Pillars since ancient times, and shares place alongside the wyverns as a symbol of Lothric.  Only those possessing a knight's resolve are fit to wear this garment.

name: Lothric Knight Armor
description: Armor of a celebrated Lothric knight. The coat of distinction is all but fallen apart.  The Knight has served as one of the Three Pillars since ancient times, and shares place alongside the wyverns as a symbol of Lothric.  Only those possessing a knight's resolve are fit to wear this garment.

name: Lothric Knight Gauntlets
description: Armor of a celebrated Lothric knight. Strong steel gauntlets, if a little scratched.  The Knight has served as one of the Three Pillars since ancient times, and shares place alongside the wyverns as a symbol of Lothric.  Only those possessing a knight's resolve are fit to wear this garment.

name: Lothric Knight Leggings
description: Armor of a celebrated Lothric knight. Strong steel leggings, if a little scratched.  The Knight has served as one of the Three Pillars since ancient times, and shares place alongside the wyverns as a symbol of Lothric.  Only those possessing a knight's resolve are fit to wear this garment.

name: Outrider Knight Helm
description: Armor of an Irithyll outrider knight. Enveloped in a dimly cool air.  The knights were given the eyes of the Pontiff, but the eyes transformed them into savage, raving warriors who only knew how to serve as mindless guards.

name: Black Knight Helm
description: Armor of the Black Knights who roam the lands.  The knights served the First Lord Gwyn, and followed him into the flame upon its linking. They became ash, but still wander the realms to this day.

name: Dark Mask
description: Bone mask of the Darkwraiths, relics of a small country that fell to the dark long ago. Looks as if it may crumble to dust at any moment.  The Darkwraiths were the oldest of the Red Eye Invaders, and rumored to have served a Primordial Serpent.

name: Dark Armor
description: Armor of the Darkwraiths, relics of a small country that fell to the dark long ago. Looks as if it may crumble to dust at any moment.  The Darkwraiths were the oldest of the Red Eye Invaders, and rumored to have served a Primordial Serpent.

name: Dark Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of the Darkwraiths, relics of a small country that fell to the dark long ago. Look as if they may crumble to dust at any moment.  The Darkwraiths were the oldest of the Red Eye Invaders, and rumored to have served a Primordial Serpent.

name: Dark Leggings
description: Leggings of the Darkwraiths, relics of a small country that fell to the dark long ago. Look as if they may crumble to dust at any moment.  The Darkwraiths were the oldest of the Red Eye Invaders, and rumored to have served a Primordial Serpent.

name: Exile Mask
description: Iron mask of the watchdogs of Farron's Keep.  After the Legion's Watchers became Lords of Cinder, the wolf blood dried up, and Farron was consumed by a festering wood.  Within the wood, an emaciated old wolf commands watchdogs to defend the sanctity of sleeping warriors.  Both the exiles were surely watchdogs themselves, for Farron has always been a land of itinerants.

name: Exile Armor
description: Armor of the watchdogs of Farron's Keep.  After the Legion's Watchers became Lords of Cinder, the wolf blood dried up, and Farron was consumed by a festering wood.  Within the wood, an emaciated old wolf commands watchdogs to defend the sanctity of sleeping warriors.  Both the exiles were surely watchdogs themselves, for Farron has always been a land of itinerants.

name: Exile Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of the watchdogs of Farron's Keep.  After the Legion's Watchers became Lords of Cinder, the wolf blood dried up, and Farron was consumed by a festering wood.  Within the wood, an emaciated old wolf commands watchdogs to defend the sanctity of sleeping warriors.  Both the exiles were surely watchdogs themselves, for Farron has always been a land of itinerants.

name: Exile Leggings
description: Leggings of the watchdogs of Farron's Keep.  After the Legion's Watchers became Lords of Cinder, the wolf blood dried up, and Farron was consumed by a festering wood.  Within the wood, an emaciated old wolf commands watchdogs to defend the sanctity of sleeping warriors.  Both the exiles were surely watchdogs themselves, for Farron has always been a land of itinerants.

name: Pontiff Knight Crown
description: Crown of the Pontiff's Knights, now harrowed spirits of Irithyll.  The golden crown signifies those who report directly to Sulyvahn. The knights were his watchful eyes, and when needed, his punitive blades.

name: Pontiff Knight Armor
description: Armor of the Pontiff's Knights, now harrowed spirits of Irithyll.  This blue-gray armor, shrouded in a thinly cold air, is light and brittle.

name: Pontiff Knight Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of the Pontiff's Knights, now harrowed spirits of Irithyll.  This blue-gray gauntlets, shrouded in a thinly cold air, is light and brittle.

name: Pontiff Knight Leggings
description: Leggings of the Pontiff's Knights, now harrowed spirits of Irithyll.  This blue-gray leggings, shrouded in a thinly cold air, is light and brittle.

name: Golden Crown
description: Crown of a nameless king who was ally to the ancient dragons.  This golden crown, buried amidst long strands of bristling ash, is said to closely resemble that of the First Lord.

name: Dragonscale Armor
description: Dragonscale armor of a nameless king who was ally to the ancient dragons.  Dragon scales are razor-sharp and cannot be burned.

name: Golden Bracelets
description: Bracelets of a nameless king who was ally to the ancient dragons.  These golden bracelets, together with the golden breastplate and crown, are said to closely resemble those of the First Lord.

name: Dragonscale Waistcloth
description: Dragonscale waistcloth of a nameless king who was ally to the ancient dragons.  Dragon scales are razor-sharp and cannot be burned.

name: Wolnir's Crown
description: Crown of Wolnir, the Carthus conqueror.  Once upon a time, such things were bequeathed judiciously to each of the rightful lords, until Wolnir brought them to their knees, and ground their crowns to dust. Then the crowns became one, and Wolnir, the one High Lord.

name: Undead Legion Helm
description: Attire of the Abyss Watchers, the Undead Legion of Farron.  These undead warriors vowed to partake of wolf blood. They acted in the dark, seeking out any sign of the Abyss, fighting a constant war with its abominations.  This pointed steel helm was a distinct symbol of the Legion, shirked as a sinister omen by the masses.

name: Undead Legion Armor
description: Attire of the Abyss Watchers, the Undead Legion of Farron. A black-dyed leather vest worn over chainmail.  These undead warriors vowed to partake of wolf blood. They acted in the dark, seeking out any sign of the Abyss, fighting a constant war with its abominations.

name: Undead Legion Gauntlet
description: Attire of the Abyss Watchers, the Undead Legion of Farron. Black-dyed leather tied around the arms, with only the left fitted with a gauntlet.  These undead warriors vowed to partake of wolf blood. They acted in the dark, seeking out any sign of the Abyss, fighting a constant war with its abominations.

name: Undead Legion Leggings
description: Attire of the Abyss Watchers, the Undead Legion of Farron. The iron kneecaps originated from their sword techniques.  These undead warriors vowed to partake of wolf blood. They acted in the dark, seeking out any sign of the Abyss, fighting a constant war with its abominations.

name: Man Serpent's Mask
description: Metallic mask worn by a man serpent priest.  There were those among the man serpents as well as people, who devoted themselves to magic, and the existence of a cane that could invoke sorceries from ages past.

name: Man Serpent's Robe
description: Robe worn by a man serpent priest.  There were those among the man serpents as well as people, who devoted themselves to magic, and the existence of a cane that could invoke sorceries from ages past.

name: Fire Witch Helm
description: Helm of witches who bore the Profaned Flame, now harrowed spirits of Irithyll.  The witches who lead the Pontiff's Knights were originally ordained as holy knights. It was not long however, before their hearts were swallowed by the Profaned Flame.

name: Fire Witch Armor
description: Armor of witches who bore the Profaned Flame, now harrowed spirits of Irithyll.  The witches who lead the Pontiff's Knights were originally ordained as holy knights. It was not long however, before their hearts were swallowed by the Profaned Flame.

name: Fire Witch Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of witches who bore the Profaned Flame, now harrowed spirits of Irithyll.  The witches who lead the Pontiff's Knights were originally ordained as holy knights. It was not long however, before their hearts were swallowed by the Profaned Flame.

name: Fire Witch Leggings
description: Leggings of witches who bore the Profaned Flame, now harrowed spirits of Irithyll.  The witches who lead the Pontiff's Knights were originally ordained as holy knights. It was not long however, before their hearts were swallowed by the Profaned Flame.

name: Lorian's Helm
description: Armor of Prince Lothric's older brother Lorian. This black-dyed brass helm is patterned with flame.  Lorian, raised as a knight, is said to have been left mute and crippled by his younger brother's curse. It is also said that Lorian, in fact, wished it so.

name: Lorian's Armor
description: Armor of Prince Lothric's older brother Lorian. This black-dyed brass armor was passed down to him from the royal family.  Lorian, raised as a knight, is said to have been left mute and crippled by his younger brother's curse. It is also said that Lorian, in fact, wished it so.

name: Lorian's Gauntlets
description: Armor of Prince Lothric's older brother Lorian. These black-dyed brass gauntlets were passed down to him from the royal family.  Lorian, raised as a knight, is said to have been left mute and crippled by his younger brother's curse. It is also said that Lorian, in fact, wished it so.

name: Lorian's Leggings
description: Armor of Prince Lothric's older brother Lorian. These black-dyed brass leggings were passed down to him from the royal family.  Lorian, raised as a knight, is said to have been left mute and crippled by his younger brother's curse. It is also said that Lorian, in fact, wished it so.

name: Hood of Prayer
description: Prince Lothric's hood.  The prince, destined to be a Lord of Cinder, was cherished by the royal family, despite being born into illness, a frail and shriveled child.  His swaddling clothes were made of aged, coarse cloth used in ancient prayer, and are all that he has ever worn.

name: Robe of Prayer
description: Prince Lothric's robe.  The prince, destined to be a Lord of Cinder, was cherished by the royal family, despite being born into illness, a frail and shriveled child.  His swaddling clothes were made of aged, coarse cloth used in ancient prayer, and are all that he has ever worn.

name: Skirt of Prayer
description: Prince Lothric's skirt.  The prince, destined to be a Lord of Cinder, was cherished by the royal family, despite being born into illness, a frail and shriveled child.  His swaddling clothes were made of aged, coarse cloth used in ancient prayer, and are all that he has ever worn.

name: Giant's crown
description: Crown embedded with the soul of the old giant, Lord of Cinder.  Reinforced with the protection of a giant, this item will repel all manner of attacks, holding fast against the wearer's enemies.

name: Giant's Armor
description: Armor embedded with the soul of the old giant, Lord of Cinder.  Reinforced with the protection of a giant, this item will repel all manner of attacks, holding fast against the wearer's enemies.

name: Giant's Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets embedded with the soul of the old giant, Lord of Cinder.  Reinforced with the protection of a giant, this item will repel all manner of attacks, holding fast against the wearer's enemies.

name: Giant's Leggings
description: Leggings embedded with the soul of the old giant, Lord of Cinder.  Reinforced with the protection of a giant, this item will repel all manner of attacks, holding fast against the wearer's enemies.

name: Dancer's Crown
description: Crown worn by the Dancer of the Boreal Valley.  The mirage-like aurora veil is said to be an article of the old gods, permitted only for direct descendants of the old royal family.

name: Dancer's Armor
description: Armor worn by the Dancer of the Boreal Valley.  The black eyes of the Pontiff eventually transformed the Dancer into a beastly creature, her armor fusing with her own hide.

name: Dancer's Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets worn by the Dancer of the Boreal Valley.  The black eyes of the Pontiff eventually transformed the Dancer into a beastly creature, her gauntlets fusing with her own hide.

name: Dancer's Leggings
description: Leggings worn by the Dancer of the Boreal Valley.  The black eyes of the Pontiff eventually transformed the Dancer into a beastly creature, her leggings fusing with her own hide.

name: Gundyr's Helm
description: Ancient helm of a set of cast iron armor, belonging to Champion Gundyr. Modeled after a former king.  Gundyr, or the Belated Champion, was bested by an unknown warrior. He then became sheath to a coiled sword in the hopes that someday, the first flame would be linked once more.

name: Gundyr's Armor
description: Ancient chest piece of a set of cast iron armor, belonging to Champion Gundyr.  Gundyr, or the Belated Champion, was bested by an unknown warrior. He then became sheath to a coiled sword in the hopes that someday, the first flame would be linked once more.

name: Gundyr's Gauntlets
description: Ancient gauntlets of a set of cast iron armor, belonging to Champion Gundyr.  Gundyr, or the Belated Champion, was bested by an unknown warrior. He then became sheath to a coiled sword in the hopes that someday, the first flame would be linked once more.

name: Gundyr's Leggings
description: Ancient leggings of a set of cast iron armor, belonging to Champion Gundyr.  Gundyr, or the Belated Champion, was bested by an unknown warrior. He then became sheath to a coiled sword in the hopes that someday, the first flame would be linked once more.

name: Old Monarch's Crown
description: Crown of the old king who protected the Frigid Valley's capital.  Much like its owner, this once glorious garment has suffered greatly from the encroachment of dark.

name: Old Monarch's Robe
description: Robe of the old king who protected the Frigid Valley's capital.  Much like its owner, this once glorious garment has suffered greatly from the encroachment of dark.

name: Archdeacon White Crown
description: White crown worn by an Archdeacon of the Cathedral of the Deep. Presented solely to delegates of the gods.  Of the three Archdeacons of the Deep, one cast off his white crown and left the cathedral to stand by Aldrich.

name: Archdeacon Holy Garb
description: Holy garb worn by an Archdeacon of the Cathedral of the Deep. A sign of the Way of White's highest rank.  Of the three Archdeacons of the Deep, one stood over Aldrich's casket, with hope that he would return one day.

name: Archdeacon Skirt
description: Skirt worn by an Archdeacon of the Cathedral of the Deep. Worn underneath holy garb.  Of the Archdeacons of the Deep, one attended to Rosaria, Mother of Rebirth, whom he deemed a goddess.

name: Deacon Robe
description: Robe worn by deacons of the Cathedral of the Deep. The deep red pigment denotes the blessing of fire.  In time, those dedicated to sealing away the horrors of the Deep succumbed to their very power. It seems that neither tending to the flame, nor the faith, could save them.

name: Deacon Skirt
description: Skirt worn by deacons of the Cathedral of the Deep, worn on the inside of the deep red robe.  In time, those dedicated to sealing away the horrors of the Deep succumbed to their very power. It seems that neither tending to the flame, nor the faith, could save them.

name: Frigid Valley Mask
description: Mask worn by the beast knight of the Frigid Valley.  The mask was created using techniques now lost. It clearly has an unusual, unsettling air about it.

name: Dingy Hood
description: Worn by a Fire Keeper.  It is thought to have once been the white hood of a maiden, but bonfire ash has darkened it over the years.

name: Fire Keeper Robe
description: Robe worn by the guardian of the shrine.  The Fire Keepers were robbed of light, to better serve as vessels for souls. Only those who cherish the writhing, searing darkness were given the keepers' black attire.

name: Fire Keeper Gloves
description: Manchettes worn by the guardian of the shrine.  The Fire Keepers were robbed of light, to better serve as vessels for souls. Only those who cherish the writhing, searing darkness were given the keepers' black attire.

name: Fire Keeper Skirt
description: Skirt worn by the guardian of the shrine.  The Fire Keepers were robbed of light, to better serve as vessels for souls. Only those who cherish the writhing, searing darkness were given the keepers' black attire.

name: Chain Helm
description: Chainmail helm of thin interlinking rings of steel. Popular due to its ease of crafting, respectable damage absorption, and light weight.  Knights may favor imposing armor, but for warriors on the battlefield, that which keeps them alive is armor enough.

name: Chain Armor
description: Chainmail armor of thin interlinking rings of steel. Popular due to its ease of crafting, respectable damage absorption, and light weight.  Knights may favor imposing armor, but for warriors on the battlefield, that which keeps them alive is armor enough.

name: Leather Gauntlets
description: Gloves made of soft leather. A common form of protection.

name: Chain Leggings
description: Chainmail leggings of thin interlinking rings of steel. Popular due to their ease of crafting, respectable damage absorption, and light weight.  Knights may favor imposing armor, but for warriors on the battlefield, that which keeps them alive is armor enough.

name: Nameless Knight Helm
description: Helm of a nameless knight. Crafted with thin metal greatly reinforced by a grooved finish.

name: Nameless Knight Armor
description: Armor of a nameless knight. Crafted with thin metal greatly reinforced by a grooved finish.

name: Nameless Knight Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets of a nameless knight. Crafted with thin metal greatly reinforced by a grooved finish.

name: Nameless Knight Leggings
description: Leggings of a nameless knight. Crafted with thin metal greatly reinforced by a grooved finish.

name: Elite Knight Helm
description: Helm said to have been given to elite knights of fallen Astora.  The mere mention of Astora invokes wistful pangs, and perhaps it was such a dream that drew Anri to this faraway home known only by name.

name: Elite Knight Armor
description: Armor said to have been given to elite knights of fallen Astora.  The mere mention of Astora invokes wistful pangs, and perhaps it was such a dream that drew Anri to this faraway home known only by name.

name: Elite Knight Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets said to have been given to elite knights of fallen Astora.  The mere mention of Astora invokes wistful pangs, and perhaps it was such a dream that drew Anri to this faraway home known only by name.

name: Elite Knight Leggings
description: Leggings said to have been given to elite knights of fallen Astora.  The mere mention of Astora invokes wistful pangs, and perhaps it was such a dream that drew Anri to this faraway home known only by name.

name: Faraam Helm
description: Helm named after a god of war.  The armor of the Forossa Lion Knights was preserved even after the destruction of their homeland, and is mentioned in numerous legends, alongside the names of those who are said to have gone beyond death.

name: Faraam Armor
description: Armor named after a god of war.  The armor of the Forossa Lion Knights was preserved even after the destruction of their homeland, and is mentioned in numerous legends, alongside the names of those who are said to have gone beyond death.

name: Faraam Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets named after a god of war.  The armor of the Forossa Lion Knights was preserved even after the destruction of their homeland, and is mentioned in numerous legends, alongside the names of those who are said to have gone beyond death.

name: Faraam Boots
description: Boots named after a god of war.  The armor of the Forossa Lion Knights was preserved even after the destruction of their homeland, and is mentioned in numerous legends, alongside the names of those who are said to have gone beyond death.

name: Catarina Helm
description: Distinctively shaped helm worn by the Knights of Catarina.  Often ridiculed for its onion-like shape, infuriating the country's proud knights, but the masterfully forged curved design makes it very effective for deflecting blows.

name: Catarina Armor
description: Distinctively shaped armor worn by the Knights of Catarina.  Often ridiculed for its onion-like shape, infuriating the country's proud knights, but the masterfully forged curved design makes it very effective for deflecting blows.

name: Catarina Gauntlets
description: Distinctively shaped gauntlets worn by the Knights of Catarina.  Often ridiculed for the onion-like shape, infuriating the country's proud knights, but the masterfully forged curved design makes them very effective for deflecting blows.

name: Catarina Leggings
description: Distinctively shaped leggings worn by the Knights of Catarina.  Often ridiculed for the onion-like shape, infuriating the country's proud knights, but the masterfully forged curved design makes them very effective for deflecting blows.

name: Standard Helm
description: A sturdy helm made of iron. Used by warriors of old, but one can still expect sound defense.  It is never unwise to wear a sturdy form of head protection against arrows and other somatic threats.

name: Hard Leather Armor
description: Armor made of thick, layered leather. Used by warriors of old, but one can still expect sound defense.

name: Hard Leather Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets made of thick leather. Used by warriors of old, but one can still expect sound defense.

name: Hard Leather Boots
description: Boots made of thick leather. Used by warriors of old, but one can still expect sound defense.

name: Havel's Helm
description: Armor as if hewn from a giant boulder. Highly protective, but excessively heavy.  The warriors who followed Havel the Rock never flinched, nor retreated from battle, crushing any foe that stood in their way.

name: Brigand Hood
description: Hood from a foreign land. Probably belonged to a brigand who met his match.  In foreign lands, undead were banished to send a message to populace, and when the message was not heard, they banished the living, too.

name: Brigand Armor
description: Leather armor from a foreign land. Probably belonged to a brigand who met his match.  In foreign lands, undead were banished to send a message to populace, and when the message was not heard, they banished the living, too.

name: Brigand Gauntlets
description: Gauntlets from a foreign land. Probably belonged to a brigand who met his match.  In foreign lands, undead were banished to send a message to populace, and when the message was not heard, they banished the living, too.

name: Brigand Trousers
description: Trousers from a foreign land. Probably belonged to a brigand who met his match.  In foreign lands, undead were banished to send a message to populace, and when the message was not heard, they banished the living, too.

name: Pharis's Hat
description: Broad-brimmed leather hat. Traditionally used by master archers, and especially favored by forest-dwelling hunters.  The name Pharis is said to have once belonged to a hero, but is now more widely known as a style of hat.

name: Leather Armor
description: Armor made of smooth leather. Even lighter and more flexible than most leather armors.

name: Leather Gloves
description: Gloves made of smooth leather. Even lighter and more flexible than most leather armors.

name: Leather Boots
description: Boots made of smooth leather. Even lighter and more flexible than most leather armors.

name: Ragged Mask
description: Rag that covers the wearer's mouth.  Likely a makeshift item that helped reduce intake of various poisonous and noxious fumes.

name: Master's Attire
description: A terribly worn shirt.  Men are fond of weaving tales to explain the raggedness of their garb.  "My sixth sense warned me of danger, and I danced between flurries of blades, unscathed, but alas, my clothes went to tatters."

name: Master's Gloves
description: Terribly worn manchettes.  Men are fond of weaving tales to explain the raggedness of their garb.  "My sixth sense warned me of danger, and I danced between flurries of blades, unscathed, but alas, my clothes went to tatters."

name: Loincloth
description: Terribly worn waistcloth.  The deprived only manage to rummage just enough cloth to protect their vital parts.

name: Old Sorcerer Hat
description: Traditional attire worn by sorcerers of the Vinheim Dragon School.  Long ago, sorcerers were said to always dress properly, even while on distant journeys of discovery, even before such journeys were established curriculum.

name: Conjurator Hood
description: Attire of traveling conjurators.  Conjurators were the predecessors to pyromancers, and spent their lives roaming the lands. No wonder their attire was designed to protect them from fire, poison, and other threats of nature.

name: Thief Mask
description: Mask of sinners. They hide their faces, stifle their voices and hide in the shadows. It does not provide much in the way of defense.

name: Black Leather Armor
description: Black dyed leather armor. Enables its wearer to hide in the shadows with silent finesse.  The wearer of this fine attire was admired by friends and enemies alike, for his skills were unmatched, and his heart was true as gold. As its new owner, you have quite the shoes to fill.

name: Black Leather Gloves
description: Black dyed leather gloves. Enables its wearer to hide in the shadows with silent finesse.  The wearer of this fine attire was admired by friends and enemies alike, for his skills were unmatched, and his heart was true as gold. As their new owner, you have quite the shoes to fill.

name: Black Leather Boots
description: Black dyed leather boots. Enables its wearer to hide in the shadows with silent finesse.  The wearer of this fine attire was admired by friends and enemies alike, for his skills were unmatched, and his heart was true as gold. As their new owner, you have quite the shoes to fill.

name: Symbol of Avarice
description: Head of the avaricious creature that mimics treasure chests. Can be worn, if one so wishes.  Increases soul absorption from defeated enemies as well as item discovery, but the curse of the branded also drains HP.  The very form of this creature is thought to be a form of brand, a punishment for sin.

name: Creighton's Steel Mask
description: Attire of Creighton the Wanderer, a notorious deserter who fled an order of Mirrah Knights.  Despite the mask's being a symbol of a criminal sentenced to death, Creighton never removed it.

name: Mirrah Chain Mail
description: Formal attire of the honorable knights of Mirrah, featuring their heraldry, a stag set against a blue field.  Oddly, it was a dishonorable deserter who wore this attire most religiously.

name: Mirrah Chain Gloves
description: Formal attire of the honorable knights of Mirrah.  Oddly, it was a dishonorable deserter who wore this attire most religiously.

name: Maiden Hood
description: White hood worn by traveling maidens. Part of their formal attire, regardless of rank.  It is soft and well-made, but ill-suited for use in battle.

name: Maiden Robe
description: White robe worn by traveling maidens. Part of their formal attire, regardless of rank.  It is soft and well-made, but ill-suited for use in battle.

name: Maiden Gloves
description: White gloves worn by traveling maidens. Part of their formal attire, regardless of rank.  They are soft and well-made, but ill-suited for use in battle.

name: Maiden Skirt
description: White skirt worn by traveling maidens. Part of their formal attire, regardless of rank.  It is soft and well-made, but ill-suited for use in battle.

name: Alva Helm
description: Protection of Alva, seeker of the spurned. This steel helm was trimmed to reduce weight.  To this day, troubadours sing of tales of the wandering knight Alva and his travels, and of his involvement with the saint and the witch. Needless to say, the songs traditionally end in tragedy.

name: Alva Armor
description: Protection of Alva, seeker of the spurned. This steel body armor was trimmed to reduce weight.  To this day, troubadours sing of tales of the wandering knight Alva and his travels, and of his involvement with the saint and the witch. Needless to say, the songs traditionally end in tragedy.

name: Alva Gauntlets
description: Protection of Alva, seeker of the spurned. These steel gauntlets trimmed to reduce weight.  To this day, troubadours sing of tales of the wandering knight Alva and his travels, and of his involvement with the saint and the witch. Needless to say, the songs traditionally end in tragedy.

name: Alva Leggings
description: Protection of Alva, seeker of the spurned. These steel leggings were trimmed to reduce weight.
